akn:subsection.akn:heading: Dual school systems as denial of equal protection; depletion of financial resources of local educational agencies; transportation of students; inadequacy of guidelines

akn:content.akn:p: (a) Dual school systems as denial of equal protection; depletion of financial resources of local educational agencies; transportation of students; inadequacy of guidelines The Congress finds that—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Necessity of Congress to specify appropriate remedies for elimination of dual school systems

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Necessity of Congress to specify appropriate remedies for elimination of dual school systems For the foregoing reasons, it is necessary and proper that the Congress, pursuant to the powers granted to it by the Constitution of the United States, specify appropriate remedies for the elimination of the vestiges of dual school systems, except that the provisions of this chapter are not intended to modify or diminish the authority of the courts of the United States to enforce fully the fifth and fourteenth amendments to the Constitution of the United States.
